TopicTitle: I want to send a kerbal to a celestial body(and return him),which body do I choose?

Articles.Content:
Hi!

My plan is to do a manned mission to another celestial body(except the Mun and Minmus(and Kerbin, of course)); which one would be the easiest to begin with?
Probably Duna. IF YOU VALUE YOUR KERBAL'S LIVES, NEVER GO TO EVE!

Duna!

Takes so little fuel to get to and back, with an atmosphere and low gravity, landing is a sinch. Use low powered engines accompanied by parachutes and you'll get your Kerbals out of there alive

Duna was my first interplanetary manned landing.

I here Tylo is lovely this time of year.

No, but seriously Duna is a great place to start.

Ok,thank you for the (fast) answer!

I will start my Duna program very soon!

So far, I ahve sent rovers,next goal is to send a probe into Duna orbit and bring it back to Kerbin orbit(if possible, land it on Kerbin).

Ok,thank you for the (fast) answer!

I will start my Duna program very soon!

So far, I ahve sent rovers,next goal is to send a probe into Duna orbit and bring it back to Kerbin orbit(if possible, land it on Kerbin).

THe order in which I explored Duna was:

First, satellite around Duna and Ike.

2nd, unmanned probe landing.

3rd, unmanned rover.

and finally 4th, a manned mission.

Probably Duna. IF YOU VALUE YOUR KERBAL'S LIVES, NEVER GO TO EVE!

All these worlds are yours, except Eve. Attempt no landing there.

All these worlds are yours, except Eve. Attempt no landing there.

Eve landing+return is benign compared to that of Jool
